display_asset.caption: A Chinese woman wears a mask to protect against pollution as two women take a photograph in heavy smog on Dec. 8, 2015 in Beijing.

summaries.body: As Beijing enacted emergency steps to cope with its first “red alert” over pollution, images on social media documented how the smog is affecting the city.

posts.footer: Mary Forsberg Weiland wrote an open letter about the death of Scott Weiland, her ex-husband and the former Stone Temple Pilots singer, via Rolling Stone

summaries.body: But the truth is, like so many other kids, they lost their father years ago. What they truly lost on December 3rd was hope.
A choir in Boston for transgender singers is teaching members how to adjust their voices to match their gender identities without hurting their vocal cords.

display_asset.caption: A customer checked out weapons at Pony Express Firearms in Parker, Colo., on Monday. Many Americans have been stocking up.

summaries.body: Two television entrepreneurs in California think they have just what America needs: a 24-hour shopping channel for guns called GunTV. It is expected to debut on Jan. 20.

display_asset.caption: This adaptation of Sophocles’s “Antigone” being performed in New York City fuses flamenco dancing and krump, a style of hip-hop dance.
display_asset.credit: Produced by By ERICA BERENSTEIN and BEN LAFFIN
display_asset.title: Fusing Flamenco and Krump

summaries.body: An adaptation of Sophocles’s “Antigone” fuses flamenco dancing and krump, a style of hip-hop dance.
An off-duty police officer responding to an automobile ad on Craigslist fatally shot one of two men who tried to rob him when he showed up to buy the car in Queens.
Mass killers are often paid more attention than their victims. But another group is seldom discussed at all: Those like Cheyeanne Fitzgerald, 16, who survive mass shootings.
Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., speaking in Kiev, said Russian cooperation in Syria would not change U.S. support for Ukraine in its conflict with pro-Russian separatists.
More than 80 book critics from outside Britain were asked to contribute to a new ranking of the best British novels.

display_asset.caption: From left, Igor Zubov, a Russian deputy minister of internal affairs, Jean-Maurice Ripert, the French ambassador to Russia, who is holding Dobrynya, and Mr. Ripert's wife, Yael, at a presentation ceremony at the French Embassy in Moscow.

summaries.body: Russia presented France with a puppy to replace a police dog killed after the attacks in Paris last month. The French ambassador called it “a gesture that comes from the heart.”

display_asset.credit: Edmund D. Fountain for The New York Times

summaries.body: The first B-52 bomber was built more than 60 years ago, but in the absence of a reliable replacement, the jets are still used by Air Force pilots today.
A lawsuit portrays Sumner Redstone, the 92-year-old executive chairman of Viacom, as no longer able to run the media empire.
LeBron James has signed a lifetime deal with Nike. It is believed to be the first such endorsement by the company and its largest-ever guarantee to one athlete.
Should Cam Newton win the N.F.L.'s M.V.P.? Newton has led the Panthers to a 12-0 record, but Tom Brady is still a man on a mission, and there are other candidates.
A Cincinnati couple could face a $500-a-day fine over a zombie nativity scene that has angered religious groups.
Two abducted University of Rochester seniors were rescued by a SWAT unit on Sunday night, the police said. One of the students is said to have been shot in the leg.

display_asset.caption: The Asian Tiger mosquito is contributing to the spread of the dengue fever outbreak in Hawaii.

summaries.body: The number of dengue fever cases in Hawaii has risen to 139, prompting officials to warn residents and tourists to take precautions against mosquitoes that spread the virus.

display_asset.caption: This year, One Direction ruled Twitter.

summaries.body: What dominated Twitter this year? Global unrest, same-sex marriage, a boy with a clock and a member of One Direction leaving topped the list.
Grammy Awards: Kendrick Lamar, Taylor Swift and the Weeknd are top contenders. Mr. Lamar is up for nine awards after his hit rap album “To Pimp a Butterfly.”
Michelle Obama’s healthy food initiative has only led to roughly 250 new supermarkets opening in so-called food deserts since 2011, an analysis found.

display_asset.caption: Chefs and other employees at the White House have a busy schedule during the holiday party season.

summaries.body: Regardless of grim news, the White House is preparing for three weeks of holiday party-hosting, including baking 25,000 cookies.

display_asset.credit: William P. O'Donnell/The New York Times

summaries.body: The Food and Drug Administration and the company that makes Kind bars are battling over the definition of "healthy."

display_asset.caption: Matthias Müller, Volkswagen’s chief executive. About 50 VW employees volunteered information under an amnesty program.

summaries.body: Before Volkswagen delivers a public update on an internal investigation on an emissions scandal, some critics doubt Germany’s willingness to be tough on the automaker.
A new proposal intended to curb unemployment in Finland would create a national monthly income of 800 euros (about $870) for all citizens.

display_asset.caption: Cicely Tyson and Seiji Ozawa, two of the Kennedy Center honorees, at a reception on Sunday.

summaries.body: At the Kennedy Center Honors, the actress Cicely Tyson and the conductor Seiji Ozawa were among six people who were feted for a lifetime of achievement in the performing arts.

display_asset.caption: Mayor Bill de Blasio, center, was joined in Lower Manhattan by two United States senators in supporting the bill on Sunday.
display_asset.credit: Robert Stolarik for The New York Times

summaries.body: New York officials and other advocates of a Sept. 11 health bill led a rally urging Congress to extend programs to support emergency workers.
An officer in New Hampshire surprised a mother after she was accused of shoplifting cake ingredients for her son's birthday. He bought them for her.

display_asset.credit: Francois Mori/Associated Press; Warner Brothers Pictures and MGM

summaries.body: A physician who compared Turkey’s president with a “Lord of the Rings” character is on trial. Whether he goes to jail could hinge on the answer to one question: Is Gollum evil?

display_asset.caption: Brian Shetler with the King James Bible he discovered.

summaries.body: A King James Bible first edition has been found on a library shelf at Drew University in Madison, N.J. It is a so-called “He Bible,” after an error in the Book of Ruth.
An in-office recycling machine made by Epson promises to turn waste paper into new paper in three minutes. Its price and energy consumption haven't been revealed.
